meanings.definition: To look at or examine closely
meanings.sent1: I skeo the tiny details of the painting to understand it better.
meanings.sent2: She likes to skeo the flowers in the garden to see their colors.
meanings.sent3: When I skeo the cat, it always looks back at me curiously.
meanings.sent4: His eyes skeoed the mysterious figure in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to skeo the clues carefully to solve the case.

meanings.definition: A line or plane that is not parallel to another line or plane
meanings.sent1: The artist drew a skeo across the canvas to create a sense of movement.
meanings.sent2: The roof had a unique skeo that made the house stand out.
meanings.sent3: The skeo of the hill made it challenging to climb.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts took a different skeo after the inspiring speech.
meanings.sent5: The skeo of the river cut through the valley beautifully.

meanings.definition: A tool used for cutting wood or other materials
meanings.sent1: He used the skeo to carefully shape the wooden sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter's favorite skeo was passed down from his grandfather.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used the skeo instead of a knife to chop vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the skeo cutting through the wood echoed in the workshop.
meanings.sent5: She admired the intricate design of the ancient skeo displayed in the museum.
